skillTree.localised_description: All Dwarfs despise the Greenskins, for the urki and grobi are the prime agents in the Times of Woe.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins

skillTree.localised_description: Dwarfs are resolute - once they commit to charging the foe, they put all their strength behind that initial blow.
Dwarfs are not fast, yet they will soldier on, always moving despite any hazards encountered.
The endless courage of the Warrior God, directed to bolster this Dawi’s own reserves.
Deep-tunnel warfare requires one to become comfortable standing closer to explosions than is perhaps sensible.

effects.description: Attacks cause "Flammable" effect, reducing fire resistance

Ammunition: +50% for Irondrakes, Ironbreakers and Miners units
	(all units in army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: Many months ago, a Dwarf expeditionary party from Zhufbar, led by veteran prospector Ruggi Redbeard, struck out into the Great Forest in search of a long-lost mining outpost established millenia before by Ruggi's ancestors. Their goal was to reach the Howling Hills, where the mines, rich with fat veins of Gromril, were said to lie.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +3 for Miners units
	(Hero's army)

skillTree.localised_description: If the mines still existed, the Dwarfs were honour-bound to reoccupy them. However, the expedition never returned, and now Ruggi's cousin, Thane Grombold Kruddsson, has gathered a second expedition to find his kin. Suspecting foul play, Grombold is accompanied by many a warrior, and has sworn a solemn oath to find the lost Dwarfs or die in the attempt.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: As the Dwarfs entered the Great Forest, they were met by an Empire Roadwarden, who gave them leave to enter the lands of his lord. The Dwarfs met him with cold cordiality, for the Men of The Empire were not beyond suspicion for the disappearance of the Dwarfs' missing kind. What if the expedition had uncovered relics of the past, and the Manlings had learned of it and murdered them to claim the treasure? Grombold thought it unlikely, though he could not be sure of anything in these dark and testing times.

The trek through the forest was arduous indeed. The Dwarfs were simply not adjusted to woodcraft, and even their great stamina was tested as they hauled their equipment over hilly terrain and through thick undergrowth.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

effects.description:
Ability: "Famed Zhufbar's Miners'' for Miner units
	(Hero's army)

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
This champion extols discipline and fear away from the battlefield as much as on it.

effects.description: Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 10%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 20%
Training action: Unit experience gain is increased by an additional 30%

skillTree.localised_description: The sight of this warrior, their stature, import or infamy, can have a calming effect.

effects.description: Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 1
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 2
Spread Control action: Control is modified by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: "If they know I'm coming then more's the better!"

effects.description: Assault Garrison action: Additional 5% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted
Assault Garrison action: Additional 30% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.
This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

items.colour_text: Mattock inscribed with two Runes of Cleaving and a Master Rune of Swiftness. It has not only seen plenty of ore, it has pierced plenty of foe a like. Being passed down from generation to generation in the Kruddsson clan, it remains as sharp as the day it was forged by smiths of Zhufbar.

item_set.name: Family Heirloom
item_set.description: Proud of his heritage, Grombold carries into battle a runic mattock, which has been passed down through generations of his family.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Miners and Hammerers units
	(Hero's army)

items.colour_text: Grombold's Gromril Armour offers some of the best protection known to the world. It has protected it's wielder from a variety of foes and blows, from rusty Skaven blades to brass Greenskin axes, one could even say it only hardens more as time progresses.

item_set.name: Family Heirloom
item_set.description: Proud of his heritage, Grombold carries into battle a runic mattock, which has been passed down through generations of his family.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -20% for Miners and Hammerers units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Grombold began his career as a Miner, and still retains ties of brotherhood with his old guild.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -10% for Miners and Hammerers units
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting against Skaven
	(Hero's army)
